examples: One survey looked at 3,375 college students during the academic year between 1987 and 1988.

words.defineEn: the period of the year during which schools and universities hold classes
words.defineVi: khoảng thời gian trong năm mà các trường học và trường đại học tổ chức các lớp học

examples: The mood states don't have to alternate.

We create this ideal alternate universe.

words.defineEn: (of two things) regularly happening one after another
words.defineVi: (của hai điều) thường xuyên xảy ra lần lượt

examples: He knew about the attack beforehand and it shows.

words.defineEn: before an event or an action

examples: The year is 1400 BCE.
In 73 BCE, the gladiator Spartacus famously led a slave revolt in Italy.
The first siren stories date back to around the 8th century BCE with Homer’s The Odyssey.
Iron production in China had been a state enterprise since 117 BCE.

words.defineEn: before common, current, or Christian era, especially used by non-Christians referring to a date before the birth of Jesus Christ
words.defineVi: trước thời đại phổ biến, hiện tại hoặc Cơ đốc giáo, đặc biệt được sử dụng bởi những người không theo đạo Cơ đốc đề cập đến một ngày trước khi Chúa Giê-su giáng sinh

examples: The Zuni and Hopi civilization roundabout here peaked about 1200 CE.

words.defineEn: common or Christian era, especially used by non-Christians referring to the years after the birth of Jesus Christ
words.defineVi: kỷ nguyên chung hoặc Cơ đốc giáo, đặc biệt được sử dụng bởi những người không theo đạo Cơ đốc đề cập đến những năm sau khi Chúa Giê-su giáng sinh

examples: The concept of a kid's mental age is essentially the level of performance associated with a certain chronological age.

And rather than describing his life events in chronological order, he jumps between times and places.
At the time, your IQ was simply your mental age, divided by your chronological age, multiplied by a hundred.
words.defineEn: organized according to the order that the events occurred in
words.defineVi: sắp xếp theo thứ tự các sự kiện xảy ra trong

examples: We cannot have indefinite detention anywhere, any time in the United States.

words.defineEn: not clearly defined; without clear limits
words.defineVi: không được xác định rõ ràng; không có giới hạn rõ ràng

examples: Be patient and trust in the process, rather than seeking instant gratification.

words.defineEn: a moment or a certain point in time
words.defineVi: một khoảnh khắc hoặc một thời điểm nhất định trong thời gian

examples: As the old proverb goes, an ordinary teacher tells, a good teacher explains, an excellent teacher inspires, and I strive to be the latter.

words.defineEn: closest to the end of a particular period of time

examples: Despite their occasional disagreements, the siblings always stood by each other's side, as they believed that blood is thicker than water.

words.defineEn: happening or done from time to time, not frequently
words.defineVi: xảy ra hoặc thực hiện theo thời gian, không thường xuyên

examples: The kitchen had a double oven, allowing for simultaneous baking of different dishes.

words.defineEn: taking place at precisely the same time

examples: They're losing $200,000 on this deal, but that's chickenfeed to a company with yearly profits of $25 million.

examples: But she always excused her language afterwards very prettily.

examples: His constant lateness was really starting to eat into their friendship.

examples: Looking at you here, leap years.

Assume for the sake of argument that there are no twins, that every birthday is equally likely, and ignore leap years.

Now, a perpetual calendar is a mechanical watch which knows the difference between a leap year and a non-leap year, and which also advances the date correctly at the end of each month, whether it's a 30-day month or a 31-day month.
words.defineEn: a year in every four years that has 366 days instead of 365

examples: For the time being, our plans remain unchanged until something convinces us otherwise.
